meanings.definition: Relating to or resembling millet seeds
meanings.sent1: The chef sprinkled miliary grains on top of the salad for added texture.
meanings.sent2: The miliary pattern on the fabric reminded her of tiny millet seeds.
meanings.sent3: The miliary design on the wallpaper made the room feel cozy and rustic.
meanings.sent4: The miliary decorations in the garden gave it a quaint and charming look.
meanings.sent5: The artist used miliary colors to create a delicate and intricate painting.

meanings.definition: A small, hard, white or yellowish spot on the skin
meanings.sent1: She noticed a miliary blemish on her cheek and applied some cream to it.
meanings.sent2: The dermatologist examined the miliary mark on the patient's arm.
meanings.sent3: The miliary spot on his nose made him look like he had a tiny freckle.
meanings.sent4: The miliary speck on the apple made it look less appetizing.
meanings.sent5: The miliary dot on the leaf caught her attention as she walked in the park.

meanings.definition: A small, hard, white or yellowish spot on the skin caused by a disease such as tuberculosis
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the patient with tuberculosis based on the miliary lesions on the skin.
meanings.sent2: The miliary rash on his back was a concerning symptom of the disease.
meanings.sent3: The miliary marks on her arm looked like tiny snowflakes scattered on her skin.
meanings.sent4: The miliary spots on the x-ray indicated the progression of the illness.
meanings.sent5: The miliary patches on his face were a visible sign of the underlying infection.
